page.title: 02ASTON UPTHORPE-ASTON TIRROLD
page.content: THE VILLAGE ITSELF IS OUTSIDE OUR SURVEY AREA.THERE IS A FARM IN THE CENTRE OF THE LAND AND THE LAND COVER INCLUDES ARABLE LAND,GRAZING AREAS AND WOODLAND.GRIM'S DITCH RUNS ALONG THE ASTON UPTHORPE DOWNS.RACING HORSES ARE EXERCISED DAILY ALONG PATHS CALLED "GALLOPS". ASTON TIRROLD:THERE IS ONLY A SMALL PART OF THE VILLAGE INCLUDED IN THE SAMPLE SURVEY.THERE ARE TWO PUBLIC HOUSES:THE CHEQUERS AND THE BOOT,A POST-OFFICE WHICH IS ALSO A GROCERY SHOP,A METHODIST CHAPEL AND A VILLAGE HALL WHICH IS USED FOR VARIOUS SOCIAL AND SPORTING ACTIVITIES.THE REST OF THE LAND COVER IONCLUDES A FARM.THIS IS BORDERED BY LAND WHICH IS DIVIDED INTO GRAZING LAND FOR COWS AND SHEEP AND ARABLE LAND GROWING WHEAT,BARLEY AND OATS AND WOODFLAND.
